metadata.title: CVE-2014-1594 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla Firefox before 34.0, Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.3, Thunderbirdbefore 31.3, and SeaMonkey before 2.31 might allow remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code by leveraging an incorrect cast from theBasicThebesLayer data type to the BasicContainerLayer data type.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1594` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 34.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 34.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 34.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 34.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:31.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:31.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:31.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:31.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:31.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:31.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:31.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:31.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '34.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:31.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
